description: Name of the database table that this column metadata describes.
Column’s position within the table, counting from 1, used for ordering.
Technical name of the column in the referenced table.
SQL data type assigned to the column (e.g., nvarchar, numeric).
Length, precision, or scale for the column’s data type, as defined in SQL.
Indicates whether the column allows NULL values (Y/N).
Technical or administrative notes about the column for data dictionary documentation.
User or system process that created this metadata record.
Timestamp when this metadata record was created.
User or system process that last modified this metadata record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this metadata record.
Human-friendly label for the column, used in UIs and reports.
Indicates whether the column is part of the table’s primary key.
Upstream source table name for lineage/ETL mapping; likely populated for imported fields; confirm with SME.
Business domain or subject area the column belongs to (e.g., asset, maintenance); confirm with SME.
Free-form business comments entered by users about the column’s meaning or usage.
Preferred display width for the column in grids/reports; used by UI layouts.
Indicates default behavior or visibility for this column in standard views; likely a Y/N flag; confirm with SME.
Preferred display order of the column in reports or list views.
Profiled count of non-null values for this column; used for data quality monitoring; confirm with SME.
Profiled count of distinct values in the column; useful for uniqueness and cardinality checks; confirm with SME.
Internal sequence number for ordering metadata records or grouping columns across screens.
Flag indicating whether this column can be updated via the public API (0/1 or Y/N).
Flag indicating whether this column is included in list/GET responses from the API (0/1 or Y/N).
Representative example value for the column, shown in documentation and profiling.
Enumerated set of allowed values or lookup codes for the column, when applicable.
Marks this field as a human-readable description for a coded value; likely a Y/N flag; confirm with SME.
Indicates the column’s values are system-generated rather than user-entered (e.g., IDs, timestamps); confirm with SME.
